title: Drawing, "Psyche Bringing to Venus a Glass from the Fountain of Youth", 1815
medium: Graphite, black, white chalk, brush and black ink on brown coated paper mounted to thin ply paperboard
inscribed: Inscribed in white, lower center margin: PSYCHÉ RAPPORTE A VENUS UNE URNE REMPLIE / DE L'EAU DE LA FONTAINE DE JOUVENCE.
provenance: Sale Paris, Prouté, 1980, lot 71; Sale Paris, Druout, December 2, 1987, lot 19; Didier Aaron, NYC
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mr. and Mrs. Christian H. Aall and from Smithsonian Institution Collections Acquisition Program Fund
description: Psyche kneeling at right offers a cup to Venus who is sitting enthroned on the left with doves in her lap.  Three unidentified maidens look on in the center of the composition.  Neoclassical architectural setting.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Psyche Bringing to Venus a Glass from the Fountain of Youth", 1815.
1815. Graphite, black, white chalk, brush and black ink on brown coated paper mounted to thin ply paperboard. Museum purchase through gift of Mr. and Mrs. Christian H. Aall and from Smithsonian Institution Collections Acquisition Program Fund. 1996-57-1.
